channel.title: How about a remix/cover 'challenge'?
channel.description:
Not sure if this has been done before, so apologies for not trawling through the backlog of threads…
Might be interesting to hear how different members each approach covering/remixing the same track.
Something that has a simple core structure or hook, like 'Shape of You' (Ed Sheeran).
One week, any interpretation/genre, any styles. Wherever inspiration takes you* Naturally, I'd expect it to be instrumental, but if some wanted to go the extra 26.2 miles, track down an acapella, well then… ;)
Two proposed conditions… 1. Keep it recognisably a cover/remix. (Don't offer a completely unrelated track.) 2. Everything must be done using Auxy – aside from introducing an acapella.
Not a competition, just for sh*ts and giggles.
  Who's up for it? :thinking: :+1:

item.title: How about a remix/cover 'challenge'?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Fwiw, I finally got round to putting some structure to my own ‘remake’ of Shape of You that led me to start this thread.
It’s a draft and maybe I’ll put some more time into it to create something I’d consider ‘finished’.
It’s a bit bitty, but I’d be interested to know y’all thoughts…

https://soundcloud.com/akasnd/shape-of-you-aka-snd-remix
https://soundcloud.com/akasnd/shape-of-you-aka-snd-reprise

Thanks! I’m glad you like it! I use a lot of computer software and write music there, and I’ve analyzed the chords and stuff to this song many times. I’m very familiar with this song in particular. Whenever I can’t come up with anything, I like analyzing songs I like and recreating them. This song is an interesting one!

item.title: How about a remix/cover 'challenge'?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Hey, @InfinityBeatz. Mate, what are you talking about?
Feel free to point out where I call you an idiot.
Again, you’re — literally, it seems — reading something in my words that simply isn’t there.

That first line was a response to your comment about plagiarism, a quick correction about a simple matter of fact (not really an agree/disagree thing). Wasn’t harshly worded.

The rest of that post wasn’t about you. It was simply getting the relevant knowledge into the thread.

Read full topic

item.title: How about a remix/cover 'challenge'?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Bassent_Chemists:

Reading through your threads akabillposters I can tell you do have a strong understanding of music theory

Zero, or close to zero, in fact.
I’ve tried to give it a go, but my head explodes when I hear things like ‘Major 7th’ and I just glaze over.

I enjoy ‘non-standard’ structures, that you’ll find in jazz, Philip Glass, etc…, but my ‘understanding’ is simply through listening and enjoying. It’s all by ear. I learn the proper names for stuff later, maybe.

I’ve never really considered it important enough and it hasn’t stopped me making music that I enjoy – for the enjoyment of making music and hearing musical ideas come to life.

 
P.S. Thanks for bothering to read my sometimes wordy posts.

Read full topic

item.title: How about a remix/cover 'challenge'?
item.dc:creator: Bassment_Chemists
item.description:
Very true man. I do prefer that track as well.

Well I don’t think I can do better by any means.

I get why you chose this now.

I’m not even sure where I would start, with my tone deff ears

Haha

I like auxy because it lets me create new melodies from scratch in a way that challenges my mind from the guitar background I come from.

Again if you’d like to try and collaborate on something I’d love the back and forth

Read full topic

item.title: How about a remix/cover 'challenge'?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Bassent_Chemists:

Like the music lab one just doesn’t do it for me.

Sounds flat without any emotion. Just recreating the vocal melody with pianos. Meh. Not for me brah.

Fair enough. It’s not to my taste either, but then it wasn’t posted as an example of (what I considered) a great interpretation, just a different interpretation, to show there are different directions a person could take a cover version of that track.

The fact that neither of us are fans of the Music Lab version doesn’t stop either of us having a crack at doing something more to our taste.

Of course, could just lay down the challenge of ‘think you could do better? Prove it!’

 
(I’ve listened to the EZA version far more times than Sheeran’s original. Just prefer it to the original – and, as said, it inspired me to suggest this challenge.)

Read full topic

item.title: How about a remix/cover 'challenge'?
item.dc:creator: Bassment_Chemists
item.description:
Agreed. This is way past my musical ability though I’m afraid. I never was formally trained in music theory or any of that. It took me almost four hours just to get the first part of drakes passionfruit to sound right on my auxy. And that’s like a ten second lick. Haha.

Reading through your threads akabillposters I can tell you do have a strong understanding of music theory and I’d love to continue learning from you and possibly collaborate on some stuff.

Read full topic

item.title: How about a remix/cover 'challenge'?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
I agree, without the vocal the challenge is harder, but there’s still a whole chunk of material within the musical composition to work with for a reinterpretation challenge.

The reason I chose this one is because the core structure would likely be recognisable across genre, even without vocals.
It would be interesting to hear which elements each person kept in order to make it recognisably a reinterpretation of a known track.

Some might choose to reproduce the vocal line using an instrument, others might prefer to build something around just the chord progression and/or lead musical melody.

Anyhoo, just a thought.

Read full topic

item.title: How about a remix/cover 'challenge'?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
To clarify, it’s not about simply remaking the track using Auxy.
The proposed challenge is to reinterpret/cover the track, in whatever style you like, using Auxy. (Probably best we avoid using any actual recordings/samples, incl. vocal.)

In terms of people being onboard, seems there’s very little interest.

Read full topic

item.title: How about a remix/cover 'challenge'?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
A cover version or remix is not plagiarism, unless the remix/cover performer/producer is passing off the original recording or composition as their own*.

Assuming you’d be rebuilding any chords, melodies, etc… from scratch, it’s a ‘publishing copyright’ issue, as you’re using the composition, but not the recording. If you were using samples, then that’s a ‘publishing + recording copyright’ issue.

All that said, it’s extremely unlikely that the publishing owner is unlikely to give a sh*t, unless, by some outlandish chance, one of our remixes/covers blew up, got serious traction and started making significant income for the remixer/cover artist.

 
Fwiw, here’s SoundCloud’s, YouTube’s and a more general outline on the question…

  • Best practices for creating and uploading a cover version
  • How to legally post a cover song video on YouTube
  • Everything You Need to Know About Releasing a Cover Song - Stem

 

 
* I hear there’s a little problem with actual plagiarism here within the Auxy community, with people passing other people’s tracks off as their own. Even so, you’d have to be a special kind of idiot to claim either the source composition or original recording of Shape of You as your own — assuming you’re not actually one of the real copyright holders, which is possible and you’re hanging out on the Auxy forum, I guess.

Read full topic

item.description:

Or step outside your usual sound, if that’s how you want to attack the challenge. All good either way.

(Might make for a good future group challenge – create a track in a genre/style you don’t usually gravitate towards.)
